references.reason: This paper proposes a method to improve the robustness of zero-shot models, a topic directly relevant to the main focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Evaluating CLIP: towards characterization of broader capabilities and downstream implications
references.reason: This paper analyzes CLIP, a foundational model for zero-shot learning, whose biases and limitations are directly addressed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Maximum likelihood with bias-corrected calibration is hard-to-beat at label shift adaptation
references.reason: This paper focuses on label shift adaptation, a key challenge in zero-shot learning that is explicitly addressed by the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Detecting and correcting for label shift with black box predictors
references.reason: This paper introduces a method to address label shift which is very relevant to the problem being solved in this paper.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a model that is used extensively in the experiments and is the foundation for many of the concepts explored in the current work.
